18 RAD2DEG = 180.0/np.pi
19 
20 
21 def reject_outliers(data, m=1):
22  """
23  Rejects one outlier.
24 
25  Arguments
26  ---------
27  `data`: `np.array`
28  The data
29 
30  `m`: `int`
31  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
32  reject data points.
33 
34  """
35  is_in_std = np.all(np.absolute(data - np.mean(data, axis=0)) < m * np.std(data, axis=0), axis=1)
36  return data[is_in_std, :]
37 
38 
39 def reject_outlier(data, m=1):
40  """
41  Rejects one outlier.
42 
43  Arguments
44  ---------
45  `data`: `np.array`
46  The data
47 
48  `m`: `int`
49  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
50  reject data points.
51  """
52  is_in_std = np.absolute(data - np.mean(data)) < m * np.std(data)
53  return data[is_in_std, :]

55 
56 class StaticPoseData():
57  """
58  Class to store static poses into a nested dictionary.
59  It is stored as in [20 poses][7 IMUs][data].
60  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.ndarray
61  The data is defined as below.
62  data = [mean x y z acceleration].
63  so the np.ndarray's dimension is (No. of collected data
64  x xyz accelerations)
65  """
66  def __init__(self, pose_names, imu_names, filepath):
67  """
68  Initialize StaticPoseData class.
69 
70  Arguments
71  ----------
72  pose_names: list[str]
73  Names of poses
74  imu_names: list[str]
75  Names of imus
76  filepath: str
77  Path to save the collected data
78  """
79  self.pose_names = pose_names
80 
81  self.imu_names = imu_names
82  self.filepath = filepath
83  self.data = OrderedDict()
84 
85  # Create nested dictionary to store data
86  for pose_name in pose_names:
87  self.data[pose_name] = OrderedDict()
88  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
89  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.empty((0, 14), float)
90 
91  def append(self, pose_name, imu_name, data):
92  """
93  Append data to a dictionary whose keys are
94  [pose_name][imu_name]
95 
96  Arguments
97  ----------
98  pose_name: str
99  Names of poses
100  imu_name: str
101  Names of imus
102  data: np.array
103  Numpy array of size (1,3).
104  Includes an accelerometer measurement.
105  """
106  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = \
107  np.append(self.data[pose_name][imu_name], np.array([data]), axis=0)
108 
109  def clean_data(self, verbose=False):
110  """
111  Cleans the data
112 
113  Arguments
114  ---------
115  `verbose`: `bool`
116  """
117  # Create nested dictionary to store data
118  # retrigger
119  data = copy.deepcopy(self.data)
120  for pose_name in self.pose_names:
121  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
122  qs = reject_outliers(self.data[pose_name][imu_name][:, :4])
123  q = np.mean(qs, axis=0)
124  d = reject_outliers(self.data[pose_name][imu_name][:, 4:7])
125  m = np.mean(d, axis=0)
126  # s = np.std(d, axis=0)
127  joints = reject_outliers(self.data[pose_name][imu_name][:, 7:])
128  j = np.mean(joints, axis=0)
129  data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.r_[q, m, j]
130  if verbose:
131  rospy.loginfo('[%s, %s] Mean Acceleration: (%.3f %.3f %.3f)' % (pose_name, imu_name, m[0], m[1], m[2]))
132 
133  return data
134 
135  def save(self, data):
136  """
137  Save both the original collected data and the averaged data
138 
139  Arguments
140  ---------
141  `data`: `OrderedDict`
142  The data from static data collection, saved to a pickle file.
143  """
144  ros_robotic_skin_path = rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin')
145  filepath = os.path.join(ros_robotic_skin_path, self.filepath+'.pickle')
146 
147  with open(filepath, 'wb') as f:
148  pickle.dump(data, f)
149 
150 
151 class StaticPoseDataSaver():
152  """
153  Class for collecting static pose data nd save them as a pickle file
154  """
155  def __init__(self, controller, poses_list, filepath='data/static_data'):
156  """
157  Initializes StaticPoseDataSaver class.
158 
159  Arguments
160  -----------
161  controller:
162  Wrapped controller to control either Panda or Sawyer robot.
163  poses_list: list
164  A list of poses. Each pose is a list.
165  It includes 7 joint positiosn, 7 joint velociites,
166  and the Pose name
167  filepath: str
168  File path to save the collected data
169  """
170  self.controller = controller
171  self.poses_list = poses_list
172 
173  self.pose_names = [pose[2] for pose in poses_list]
174  self.joint_names = self.controller.joint_names
175  # get imu names (with connected link info) and topic names.
176  self.imu_names, self.imu_topics = utils.get_imu_names_and_topics()
177 
178  self.curr_pose_name = self.pose_names[0]
179  self.ready = False
180 
181  # data storage
182  self.data_storage = StaticPoseData(self.pose_names, self.imu_names, filepath)
183 
184  # Subscribe to IMUs
185  for imu_topic in self.imu_topics:
186  rospy.Subscriber(imu_topic, Imu, self.callback)
187 
188  def callback(self, data):
189  """
190  A callback function for IMU topics.
191 
192  Arguments
193  ----------
194  data: sensor_msgs.msg.Imu
195  IMU data. Please refer to the official documentation.
196  http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html
197  """
198  if self.ready:
199  acceleration = utils.Vector3_to_np(data.linear_acceleration)
200  quaternion = utils.Quaternion_to_np(data.orientation)
201  joint_angles = self.controller.joint_angles
202 
203  self.data_storage.append(
204  pose_name=self.curr_pose_name, # for each defined initial pose
205  imu_name=data.header.frame_id, # for each imu
206  data=np.r_[
207  quaternion,
208  acceleration,
209  joint_angles
210  ]
211  )
212 
213  def set_poses(self, time=3.0):
214  """
215  Move to the defined poses and collect the IMU data
216  for a given amount of time.
217 
218  time: float
219  Time to collect the IMU data
220  """
221  for pose in self.poses_list:
222  positions, _, pose_name = pose[0], pose[1], pose[2] # noqa: F841
223  self.controller.publish_positions(positions, 0.1)
224  print('At Position: ' + pose_name, map(int, RAD2DEG*np.array(positions)))
225  self.curr_pose_name = pose_name
226  rospy.sleep(0.5)
227  self.ready = True
228  rospy.sleep(time)
229  self.ready = False
230 
231  def save(self, save=True, verbose=False):
232  """
233  Save data to a pickle file.
234  """
235  data = self.data_storage.clean_data(verbose)
236 
237  if save:
238  self.data_storage.save(data)
239 
240 
241 if __name__ == "__main__":
242  # get poses from file?
243  # robot = sys.argv[1]
244  robot = 'panda'
245  if robot == 'panda':
246  controller = PandaController()
247  filename = 'panda_positions.txt'
248  elif robot == 'sawyer':
249  controller = SawyerController()
250  filename = 'sawyer_positions.txt'
251  else:
252  raise ValueError("Must be either panda or sawyer")
253 
254  if len(sys.argv) > 2:
255  filename = sys.argv[2]
256 
257  poses_list = utils.get_poses_list_file(filename)
258  filepath = '_'.join(['data/static_data', robot])
259 
260  sd = StaticPoseDataSaver(controller, poses_list, filepath)
261  sd.set_poses()
262  sd.save(save=True, verbose=True)
